name: txt_be
desc:
BE (Verb): Causes the subject to become an object or have a property.
Anti: mirror

name: txt_ben't
desc: BE N'T (Verb): The same as having these two text tiles in a row.

name: txt_got
desc:
GOT (Verb): Causes the subject to drop the object when destroyed.
Anti: mirror

name: txt_creat
desc:
CREAT (Verb): At end of turn, the unit makes this object.
Anti: snacc

name: txt_snacc
desc:
SNACC (Verb): Units destroy any other unit that they SNACC on contact, like a conditional OUCH.
Anti: creat

name: txt_moov
desc:
MOOV (Verb): A verbified GO AWAY PLS/GO. x MOOV y means that x can push and shift y (shift not stacking). y is not treated as solid if unable to be pushed. MOOV GO^ will make the unit move one unit in that direction per turn.
Anti: opposite direction

name: txt_yeet
desc:
YEET (Verb): This unit will force things it yeets in its tile to hurtle across the level in its facing direction (until it hits an object that stops it). YEET GO^ makes the object fall in that direction.
Anti: opposite direction

name: txt_spoop
desc:
SPOOP (Verb): A SPOOPY unit forces all objects it SPOOPS on adjacent tiles to move away!
Anti: opposite direction

name: txt_stalk
desc:
STALK (Verb): If X stalks Y, X becomes an intelligent AI determined to get to Y. If it's also STUBBN, it'll try to track through walls if it can't reach its target. (actually that's not implemented yet)
Anti: finds direction that gives farthest possible

name: txt_haet
desc:
HAET (Verb): A unit cannot stop onto a tile that has something it HAETs (treating it like NOGO). (x HAET LVL makes x unable to move.)
Anti: liek

name: txt_liek
desc:
LIEK (Verb): If a unit LIEKs objects, it is picky, and cannot step onto a tile unless it has at least one object it LIEKs. If an object LIEKs zero objects, it is not bounded.
Anti: haet

name: txt_copkat
desc:
COPKAT (Verb): COPKAT units copy the successful movements of the indicated object, no matter how far away.
Anti: opposite direction

name: txt_ignor
desc:
IGNOR (Verb): x IGNOR y causes x to not be able to interact with or move y in any way.
Anti: only x can affect y

name: txt_vs
desc:
VS (Verb): The two objects enter a 1 on 1 battle: whoever steps on the other wins.
Anti: when the objects are on each other, they make heart particles

name: txt_sing
desc:
SING (Verb): SING A-G with letters!
Anti: (todo: write this)

name: txt_soko
desc:
SOKO (Verb): If X SOKO Y, then X wins when all Y are not frenles.
Anti: ...when all Y are frenles

name: txt_giv
desc:
GIV (Verb): If X giv Y, any other units in the same space and flye will get the Y property.
Anti: removes the property (ben'tn't still works)

name: txt_rp
desc:
RP: X RP Y gives X all of the properties of Y. Only an object that actually exists can be RP'd.
Anti: mirror

name: txt_wont
desc:
WON'T: X WON'T PROPERTY makes X not be affected by that property.
wontn't has an alias of wo
Anti: n't

name: txt_wontn't
desc: WO: won't n't.

name: txt_paint
desc:
PAINT (Verb): changes the second object's color to match the first if the objects are on each other. Supports color mixing.
Anti: mirror

name: txt_is
desc:
IS (Verb): Causes the subject to become an object or have a property.
Anti: mirror

name: txt_isn't
desc: IS NOT (Verb): The same as having these two text tiles in a row.
